byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio announces Police Dept will be on heightened alert in days before presidential election in response to possible threat passed on by federal authorities; unclassified bulletin warns of attack by Al Qaeda in three states, including New York.
lead_paragraph: An F.B.I. bulletin said that Al Qaeda might be planning attacks for Monday, but an official said there was skepticism about the credibility of the information.
snippet: An F.B.I. bulletin said that Al Qaeda might be planning attacks for Monday, but an official said there was skepticism about the credibility of the information....

headline.main: New York Police on Alert After Warning of Terror Attack Before Election
headline.print_headline: Police Dept. Put on Alert by Threat of Terrorism
